main event: On August 6, 1965, in Sioux City, Iowa, a witness observed a large star-like object changing colors (green, red, blue, white) for approximately 15 minutes before it disappeared.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a quarter held at arm's length., The objects were flying in a 'V' formation when first observed., The witness reported having seen similar objects the week prior., The initial conclusion by the investigating officials was that the object was likely a weather balloon., Photographs taken during the sightings did not turn out as expected.
witness description: A middle-aged male college professor who reported a clear view of the object.
